file_content.text: You've done a great thing for the Empire. I hope you realize that.
Great work! You've done a great service to Thul and the Empire.
Tell me you defeated Vessex.
Tell me you managed to destroy the evidence of Thul's misdeeds before Ulgo was able to distribute it.
Thul's secrets are safe.
The deed is done.
On my honor.
Time to pay up.
Never in my entire life have I been so relieved. Here is a reward from House Thul.
You must find the evidence and destroy it, before Ulgo shares it with the other houses.
Hurry, that assassin cannot be allowed to sell House Thul's secrets to the highest bidder!
Ah, Sith, Dathis Elgin, Imperial advisor to House Thul. Am I glad to see you.
Ah, agent, Dathis Elgin, Imperial advisor to House Thul. Am I glad to see you.
Ah, hunter, Dathis Elgin, Imperial advisor to House Thul. Am I glad to see you.
House Thul faces a crisis that threatens to undermine their entire position on Alderaan... and the Empire's as well.
You'll have to tell me what this crisis is before I agree to anything.
Care to fill me in?
It can't be that bad, can it?
Really?
I am not prone to exaggeration.
Credits, please.
If you save Thul, I'm sure they'll gladly provide a reward.
House Rist, Alderaan's house of assassins, is currently aligned with the usurper, House Ulgo.
But there was a time when Rist did all manner of secret jobs for whomever paid. Now the dirty details of those jobs are threatening to get out.
Do you need me to go teach this House Rist a lesson?
I can take them.
Rist has held to their honor--they are not responsible for the current predicament.
Next time don't hire assassins.
What did you expect?
Every noble house on Alderaan has done underhanded things. Thul is not unique.
Remind me why I care?
A former Rist assassin--kicked out for revealing the identity of one of his employers--is blackmailing Thul.
He says he'll reveal every assassination, every kidnapping, every conniving thing Thul has done unless we pay him.
Just tell me where he is and I'll kill him.
I'll silence him all right.
I'd rather not have him killed, if possible. It raises too many questions.
What's my role in this?
We wouldn't want that to happen now, would we?
I'm not impressed.
If Thul is brought down, we might as well just hand the planet back to the Republic.
We've arranged a meeting to deliver payment, but he's recruited some of Rist's best assassins to his side. I don't trust him.
That's why I need you--someone strong enough to withstand whatever trap he intends to spring.
So what exactly do I do?
What's the mission?
I can do that.
This man wants to establish his own house of assassins, and he has demanded land and a title as payment for his silence.
Take this case and meet him at the assigned meeting place. If he takes the bribe, fine. If not, kill him.
No, thank you. [Refuse quest]
If you're content to see Thul humiliated and the Empire fail, then I'll not bother you any longer.
I'm sorry, I'm too busy to talk right now.
Master Dathis = alert // N5 = message from Lieutenant Muir // Lieutenant Muir = servant to Darth Viktus
Lieutenant Muir = requests meeting with Imperial squad // Meeting = urgent // N5 = uploaded coordinates
Lieutenant Muir = requests meeting with Sith master // Meeting = urgent // N5 = uploaded coordinates
Lieutenant Muir = requests meeting with agent // Meeting = urgent // N5 = uploaded coordinates
Lieutenant Muir = requests meeting with mercenary // Meeting = urgent // N5 = uploaded coordinates
Master Dathis = alert // Imperial squad = returned from mission // Imperial squad = appear successful
Master Dathis = alert // Sith master = returned from mission // Sith master = appears successful
Master Dathis = alert // Agent = returned from mission // Agent = appears successful
Master Dathis = alert // Mercenary = returned from mission // Mercenary = appears successful
